title: 105_s243
content: The Act may be cited as the "Airport and Airway Trust Fund Taxes Short Term Reinstatement Act" and temporarily reinstates airport and airway trust fund taxes. The Fuel Tax rates are amended to 4.3 cents per gallon for aviation gasoline after specific dates mentioned in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to change the dates for the Fuel Tax rates for aviation gasoline. Ticket taxes and transfer to the Airport and Airway Trust Fund are also affected by the changes in the code. The amendment changes the dates for Fuel Tax rates for aviation gasoline and imposes a floor stocks tax on aviation fuel held before a specified date. A floor stocks tax of 17.5 cents per gallon is imposed on aviation fuel held before a specified tax-increase date. Liability for the tax and method of payment are outlined, with definitions provided for terms like "the Code" and "aviation fuel." The floor stocks tax of 17.5 cents per gallon applies to aviation fuel held before a specific tax-increase date. The tax does not apply to fuel held exclusively for certain uses or if the aggregate amount held by a person on the tax-increase date is below a certain threshold. The floor stocks tax of 17.5 cents per gallon applies to aviation fuel held before a specific tax-increase date, with exemptions for fuel held for certain uses or below a threshold of 2,000 gallons. Controlled groups are treated as one group for tax purposes. The floor stocks tax of 17.5 cents per gallon applies to aviation fuel held before a specific tax-increase date, with exemptions for fuel held for certain uses or below a threshold of 2,000 gallons. Controlled groups are treated as one group for tax purposes, with specific criteria outlined for nonincorporated persons under common control. All provisions of law applicable to taxes imposed by section 4091 of the Code also apply, insofar as applicable and not inconsistent with the provisions of this subsection. The amendments made by this section take effect 7 days after the date of enactment of this Act. The taxes imposed by sections 4261 and 4271 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 do not apply to amounts paid for taxable transportation after December 31, 1996, and before the effective date of the amendments made by this section. The amendment in Section 3 of the Code states that any taxes received in the Treasury after specific dates shall be treated as received the day before such date, regardless of when actually received. This amendment applies to amounts received after December 31, 1995.
